name: (2Z)-2-(1,3-Benzodioxol-5-ylmethylene)-6,7-dihydro-5H-[1,3]thiazolo[3,2-a]pyrimidin-3(2H)-one
Reason: 1,3-Benzodioxole base, with a melting point around 106°C, due to the presence of two carbonyl groups and the rigid structure they form. The methylene bridge (O=C1C(SC2=NCCCN12)=Cc4ccc3OCOc3c4) adds rigidity and molecular weight, estimated at around +20. The thiazole ring introduces additional rigid structures that can participate in dipole interactions, raising the melting point by about +30. The pyrimidine ring introduces additional rigid structures that can participate in dipole interactions, raising the melting point by about +20. The methyl group reduces the melting point due to the reduced symmetry and molecular volume, estimated at around -5.
